topics.body:
May I ask all the science-y people around here a question?

So let's imagine that I shrunk myself to a millimeter in height. Then I shrunk myself again to what would be a millimeter relevant to my height. Then I shrunk myself again, and again, and again, and so on.

If I can keep doing this an infinite amount of times, relatively, how is it possible for objects to touch?
topics.author: 0475a09d6361647ef3d85500

topics.body:
"@Herrpface":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/5573be4f63687240590002eb#post_5573be4f63687240590002eb
I don't get it.
How is your height somehow involved with two objects having physical contact?
topics.author: 4fe1b9f47f123b13df002976

topics.body:
"@Herrpface":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/5573be4f63687240590002eb#post_5573be4f63687240590002eb
If you kept the same mass you would instantly die.

If you didn't you would starve to death cause you would need the same amount of food and you wouldn't be able to eat it.

If you shrunk yourself too much you would collapse in on yourself.
topics.author: 38b55cdf63616403d7560600
